title: I wish I would be I Paris someday
review: I'm not talking about the storyline here but my experience. If you want to read, read or please scroll down.I think this movie has something to be attracted with. Paris indeed is an epicentre for arts & culture. The way Gil Pender introduced us with the amazing Ernest Hemingway, Pablo Picasso, Salvador Dali and many others.... it's what an art loving audience would love to watch. Even if you aren't an arts & culture lover, never been acquainted with their famous writings before, you'll feel it enjoyable too. Maybe, in midnight dreams you would have a nice time with them, who knows? (just kidding) ðŸ˜ŠOverall, it's soothing and surreal one to enjoy.

title: Copy of 'Abres los ojos'
review:
It's copy, but if u watch it first time you're gonna love it. Twisting plots are absolutely a gem to enjoy. Tom Cruise, Penelope Cruz, Cameron Diaz nailed it.
Actually I don't see copied movies but this one really caught my attention. Good to watch.

title: 'Awesome' is not enough to say about the movie, it's beyond it
review: I have watched it late, but I do belive that such incredible works never get old. If you missed it, come on let's have a watch! I bet you won't regret. And Chris Gardner, salute to you for that you finally got to see what 'happyness' is..... Will Smith.. Sir, you rock!!
